# Date set Overview


::: {.cell}

:::


Analyzing the effects of mandatory seat belt laws on traffic fatalities and seat belt usage rates in the United States from 1983-1997.

Enforcement is Measured through 3 variables:

\- Primary: allow law enforcement officers to stop vehicles if a driver or passenger is not wearing a seat belt.Â 

\- No

\- Secondary Enforcement: laws only allow police officers to issue tickets for seat belt violations if drivers have been pulled over for some other offense.

# Research Questions

1.  How do mandatory seat belt laws impact traffic fatalities across different US states over time? This research question could involve analyzing the relationship between the presence and enforcement of seat belt laws and the number of fatalities per million traffic miles, considering variations between states and changes over the years.

2.  What factors influence seat belt usage rates in the United States, and how do these factors interact with one another?

------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Shiny Application 2: Impact of Seat Belt Laws on Traffic Fatalities


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
`<iframe data-deferred-src="app9d136e381dcd782df3ba8d322fabfce4/?w=&__subapp__=1" width="100%" height="400" class="shiny-frame shiny-frame-deferred"></iframe>`{=html}
:::
:::


## Data Analysis

The data shows strong evidence that the implication as well as enforcement of seat belt laws has been an effective way to increase fatalities as well as seat belt use.

What struck me was just how rapid seat belt use and enforcement grew over such a short time.

# Thank you!

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
